H0.text: Mass is the property that can exist as solids, liquids, and gases.

H1.text: Matter is the substance that can exist as solids, liquids, and gases.

H2.text: Weight is a property that solids, liquids, and gases possess.

H3.text: Volume is the property that can exist in solid, liquid, and gas states.

A4.text: In bulk, matter can exist in several different forms, or states of aggregation, known as phases, depending on ambient pressure, temperature and volume.

A5.text: In classical physics and general chemistry, matter is any substance that has mass and takes up space by having volume.

A6.text: Short videos demonstrating of States of Matter, solids, liquids and gases by Prof. J M Murrell, University of Sussex
